page.title: 09A MIXED FARM (continued)
page.content: In November the dairy herd is brought in to be housed for the winter in the cubicle shed.The{cows}are fed on silage which is available for them to help themselves at any time.The Welsh half breed{ewes}are lambed after Xmas and this is also the start of the calving season.Springtime is the time to spread fertilisers to encourage growth of early grass in preparation for cows to be let out again, also the silage to be cut and stored.Corn crops are sprayed for disease and weed prevention and dressed with fertiliser {Lambs}are marketed when heavy enough.A 2nd crop of silage is cut in Summer, corn crops are harvested and straw is baled for winter litter.This year it has been a difficult harvest due to bad weather and the newly introduced milk quotas have hit many farmers.
